result.execSummary:
The defendant Victor A Guajardo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: 15CF562, 15CF682 & 15CM865, but consecutive to anyother sentence.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Obtain High School Diploma.   
Obtain and maintain full-time employment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Undergo any cognitive assessment deemed appropriate by the department.
Expungement to be granted upon successfully completion of probation.
Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

from def re attorney

Defendant Victor A Guajardo in court, in custody.  Carolyn Hillery Delery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Matter is scheduled for Sentencing hearing on revocation.
The Court calls the PD's office to find out who the atty is on these cases.
Atty Laura Walker has been appointed to represent the deft but is not here this afternoon.
Deft indicates atty Walker was supposed to have w/drawn from his cases.
The Court attempts to call atty Walker but gets voicemail.
BTC: Matter adjourned, Clerk to email atty Walker and DA and have them come in to speak with Judge about calendaring.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for September 19, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
